required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Anesthesia Type on RIRS
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Anesthesia Type on the Surgical Field in Retrograde Intrarenal Surgery With Flexible Ureteroscopy in Renal Stone Patients

collaborator.agency: Seoul Metropolitan Government Seoul National University Boramae Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
Retrograde intrarenal surgery (RIRS) with flexible ureteroscopy is based on video monitoring of urinary tract during operation. Therefore, shaking vision on monitor can bother surgeons and make them tired. This can lead in tissue injury from lasing.
The purpose of this study is to investigate the stability of monitoring of surgical field which is assessed by surgeon.

detailed_description.textblock:
RIRS with flexible ureteroscopy is usually performed under general anesthesia, spinal anesthesia without sedation, or spinal anesthesia with sedation.
Anesthesia type is decided in the basis of medical condition of a patient and patient's preference.
This study is a prospective observational study. During operation after induction of anesthesia, surgeons will be asked how visual stability of surgical field on monitor is (scale from 0 to 10).
According to anesthesia type (general anesthesia, spinal anesthesia without sedation, or spinal anesthesia with sedation), 34 patients will be enrolled and investigated in each group.
Investigators will compare the scale for visual stability of surgical field during RIRS.

primary_outcome.description: VAS (from 1 to 10) for stability in monitoring of surgical field, which is assessed by surgeons

arm_group.description: Patients in general anesthesia group are scheduled to undergo RIRS under general anesthesia.
Patients in general anesthesia group are scheduled to undergo RIRS under spinal anesthesia without sedation.
Patients in general anesthesia group are scheduled to undergo RIRS under spinal anesthesia with sedation.

study_pop.textblock: Patients requiring RIRS because of renal stone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients requiring RIRS because of renal stone.
Exclusion Criteria:
- disagreement for the trial.

overall_official.affiliation: Seoul Metropolitan Government Seoul National University Boramae Medical Center
